<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/08/mit-media-lab-fire-epstein-ties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MIT Media Lab Under Fire Over Epstein Ties
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="MIT Media Lab Under Fire Over Epstein Ties" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY3OTU2MTcwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/63869057@N00" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sayamindu Dasgupta</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MIT_Media_Lab_(E14).jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MIT Media Lab (E14)</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday, The New Yorker published <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-an-elite-university-research-center-concealed-its-relationship-with-jeffrey-epstein?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an explosive piece</a> about the MIT Media Lab’s ties to Jeffrey Epstein, the former financier and convicted sex offender who was charged with sex trafficking. Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail last month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the report, the Media Lab... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kept donations from Epstein anonymous</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Accepted more money from him than it acknowledged in public </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>Accepted Epstein's money even though he was labeled “disqualified” in the school's official donor database</span></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Covered up Epstein’s role as a liaison with other wealthy donors </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Media Lab’s director, Joi Ito, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/07/business/mit-media-lab-jeffrey-epstein-joichi-ito.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned</a> less than 24 hours after the New Yorker story was published. The president of the university said MIT's general counsel is hiring a law firm to launch an independent investigation. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's talk about the lab</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The story alleges that Epstein served as a go-between connecting the Media Lab with prominent businessmen like Bill Gates and investor Leon Black of Apollo Global Management. Gates denied that Epstein directed his grantmaking, and Black hasn’t commented. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What the MIT Media Lab actually is:</strong> The NYT describes the research center as “a sort of academic skunkworks” that “prides itself on contrarian thinking.” It facilitates research across academic disciplines, with a particular focus on tech, media, science, art, and design. It’s contributed to the development of groundbreaking tech like GPS and the touchscreen. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some current projects: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><a href="https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/lifelong-kindergarten/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lifelong Kindergarten</a></span><span>,” which uses tech to introduce new ways of creative learning</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><a href="https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/mediated-matter/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mediated Matter</a></span><span>,” a group that “focuses on Nature-inspired design and design-inspired Nature” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><a href="https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/responsive-environments/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Responsive Environments</a></span><span>,” which explores how sensors influence human relationships</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Some researchers say the Media Lab’s ties to Epstein were especially troubling coming from a scientific research institution. Kim Holleman, an artist and former visiting scholar at the lab, pointed out that she and others at MIT had been working to “try to make STEM fields safe and welcoming, attractive fields for women and girls in the face of crushing sexism and gender bias.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F09%2F08%2Fmit-media-lab-fire-epstein-ties" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/08/king-salman-appoints-prince-abdulaziz-bin-salman-energy-minister?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
King Salman Keeps It in the Family
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Saudi Arabia’s King Salman has <a href="https://apnews.com/0f94365bdc2f493cbf7445290f5f4962?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tapped</a> one of his sons, Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman, to become the country’s new energy minister, a crucial position that influences oil markets around the world. Prince Abdulaziz is also the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-07/saudi-replaces-energy-minister-al-falih-with-an-mbs-brother?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">half-brother</a> of the powerful Saudi Crown Prince, Mohammed bin Salman (MBS).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He'll try not to disappoint his half-brother like the outgoing energy minister Khalid al-Falih did. Given Saudi Arabia’s prodigious oil output, al-Falih was perhaps the “most closely watched figure in the oil industry,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/08/world/middleeast/saudi-arabia-abdulaziz-energy-minister.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the NYT</a>, but he wasn’t able to boost oil prices to necessary levels ($70–$80 a barrel). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Al-Falih was already walking the plank. </strong></span><span>Last week, he was removed as chairman of the state-owned oil giant Aramco, and before that he’d been </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-arabia-names-new-energy-minister-11567895724?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stripped</a></span><span> of his industrial decision-making powers. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Prince Abdulaziz, he’s shown himself to be capable in a variety of government roles since the ’80s. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Explaining the shakeup: </strong>MBS is trying to reduce the kingdom’s economic dependence on oil, but he needs more proceeds from oil to fund that shift.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/08/vws-got-new-lookand-new-cars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
VW’s Glowing Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Volkswagen got its braces off over the summer, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/08/business/volkswagen-trademark-electric-vehicles.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolling out</a> a whole new look for back to school season. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">VW will reveal two new vehicles at the Frankfurt International Motor Show tomorrow. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ID.3 is an affordable, all-electric model VW hopes will become a “true electric people’s car,” said an IHS Markit industry expert. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Porsche’s </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/04/porsche-joins-electric-car-chase?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Taycan sedan</a></span><span> is the VW-owned brand’s first all-electric sports car. It’s a direct shot at the Tesla Model S.  </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> VW, the world’s largest carmaker, is trying to show the young electric vehicle bucks like Rivian, Dyson, and (of course) Tesla it can gracefully transition into the next great auto age of emission-free cars. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But the kicker is a new logo</strong>. VW has been testing the badge on prototype cars already, but the <a href="https://autoweek.com/article/frankfurt-motor-show/vw-will-reveal-new-logo-frankfurt-motor-show?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">official unveiling</a> will happen in Frankfurt. Autoweek writes the new two-dimensional logo is both retro and geared for the digital age. You tell us.<img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567963417.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>VW</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The visual overhaul is part of a <a href="https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/volkswagens-new-branding-part-company-wide-reboot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wholesale brand reboot</a> to let bygone diesel emissions scandals be bygones. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FIXED INCOME
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/08/historic-first-week-september-corporate-bonds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So Many Bonds, So Little Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know you’re sick and tired of hearing about corporate bonds in the Brew, but we simply <em>cannot ignore</em> last week’s historic binge. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies sold at least $150 billion-equivalent of bonds in the first week of September, the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/965d72e2-d0cd-11e9-b018-ca4456540ea6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest weekly volume</a> on record. As Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-06/a-150-billion-global-corporate-bond-binge-is-smashing-records?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a>, bond bankers have “never had such an abrupt transition from leisurely summer lunches to scarfing down sandwiches at their desks.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s keeping them busy:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple </strong></span><span>sold $7 billion of debt in its </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-leads-corporate-bond-bonanza-11567617933?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first bond deal</a></span><span> since November 2017. Blue chips like Coca-Cola and Disney also issued new bonds.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Berkshire Hathaway</strong></span><span> issued $4 billion in yen-denominated bonds, the biggest yen bond sale by a non-Japanese company. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Restaurant Brands</strong></span><span>, the owner of Popeyes and Burger King, issued junk bonds at </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-06/popeyes-junk-bonds-a-sell-out-just-like-its-chicken-sandwiches?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">historically low rates</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Driving the binge: </strong>Interest rates are down around the world. Companies are taking advantage of low borrowing costs to refinance existing debt, not unlike what’s been happening in the mortgage market.  </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/08/week-ahead-septemer-9?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

The Busy Week Ahead

<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>Consumer credit; Congress reconvenes</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Apple iPhone event; job openings data; Margaret Atwood’s sequel to <em>The Handmaid’s Tale </em>released; World Suicide Prevention Day</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Producer prices data; 18th anniversary of the 9/11 terrorist attacks </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Consumer Price Index inflation data; European Central Bank policy meeting; earnings (Kroger, Broadcom); Democratic presidential debate in Houston </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Retail sales; Work From Home Friday the 13th Day (make sure your boss knows about this before you celebrate)</p>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday, The New Yorker published \u003ca href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-an-elite-university-research-center-concealed-its-relationship-with-jeffrey-epstein?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ean explosive piece\u003c/a\u003e about the MIT Media Lab’s ties to Jeffrey Epstein, the former financier and convicted sex offender who was charged with sex trafficking. Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the report, the Media Lab... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKept donations from Epstein anonymous\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccepted more money from him than it acknowledged in public \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccepted Epstein's money even though he was labeled “disqualified” in the school's official donor database\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCovered up Epstein’s role as a liaison with other wealthy donors \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Media Lab’s director, Joi Ito, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/07/business/mit-media-lab-jeffrey-epstein-joichi-ito.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresigned\u003c/a\u003e less than 24 hours after the New Yorker story was published. The president of the university said MIT's general counsel is hiring a law firm to launch an independent investigation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's talk about the lab\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe story alleges that Epstein served as a go-between connecting the Media Lab with prominent businessmen like Bill Gates and investor Leon Black of Apollo Global Management. Gates denied that Epstein directed his grantmaking, and Black hasn’t commented. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat the MIT Media Lab actually is:\u003c/strong\u003e The NYT describes the research center as “a sort of academic skunkworks” that “prides itself on contrarian thinking.” It facilitates research across academic disciplines, with a particular focus on tech, media, science, art, and design. It’s contributed to the development of groundbreaking tech like GPS and the touchscreen. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome current projects: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/lifelong-kindergarten/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLifelong Kindergarten\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” which uses tech to introduce new ways of creative learning\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/mediated-matter/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMediated Matter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” a group that “focuses on Nature-inspired design and design-inspired Nature” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.media.mit.edu/groups/responsive-environments/overview/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid relationships\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSaudi Arabia’s King Salman has \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/0f94365bdc2f493cbf7445290f5f4962?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etapped\u003c/a\u003e one of his sons, Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman, to become the country’s new energy minister, a crucial position that influences oil markets around the world. Prince Abdulaziz is also the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-07/saudi-replaces-energy-minister-al-falih-with-an-mbs-brother?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalf-brother\u003c/a\u003e of the powerful Saudi Crown Prince, Mohammed bin Salman (MBS).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe'll try not to disappoint his half-brother like the outgoing energy minister Khalid al-Falih did. Given Saudi Arabia’s prodigious oil output, al-Falih was perhaps the “most closely watched figure in the oil industry,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/08/world/middleeast/saudi-arabia-abdulaziz-energy-minister.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the NYT\u003c/a\u003e, but he wasn’t able to boost oil prices to necessary levels ($70–$80 a barrel). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAl-Falih was already walking the plank. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast week, he was removed as chairman of the state-owned oil giant Aramco, and before that he’d been \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-arabia-names-new-energy-minister-11567895724?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estripped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of his industrial decision-making powers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for Prince Abdulaziz, he’s shown himself to be capable in a variety of government roles since the ’80s. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eExplaining the shakeup: \u003c/strong\u003eMBS is trying to reduce the kingdom’s economic dependence on oil, but he needs more proceeds from oil to fund that shift.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable September, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/965d72e2-d0cd-11e9-b018-ca4456540ea6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest weekly volume\u003c/a\u003e on record. As Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-06/a-150-billion-global-corporate-bond-binge-is-smashing-records?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e, bond bankers have “never had such an abrupt transition from leisurely summer lunches to scarfing down sandwiches at their desks.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s keeping them busy:\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003esold $7 billion of debt in its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-leads-corporate-bond-bonanza-11567617933?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst bond deal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since November 2017. Blue chips like Coca-Cola and Disney also issued new bonds.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBerkshire Hathaway\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e issued $4 billion in yen-denominated bonds, the biggest yen bond sale by a non-Japanese company. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRestaurant Brands\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the owner of Popeyes and Burger King, issued junk bonds at \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-06/popeyes-junk-bonds-a-sell-out-just-like-its-chicken-sandwiches?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistorically low rates\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDriving the binge: \u003c/strong\u003eInterest rates are down around the world.
